Package com.manyangled.gibbous.optim.convex

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BacktrackAlpha
    The backtracking alpha parameter, used in NewtonOptimizer.
    BacktrackBeta
    The backtracking beta parameter, used in NewtonOptimizer.
    BarrierOptimizer
    An optimizer that can minimize a convex function in the presence of a set of convex inequality constraints and linear equality constraints.
    CholeskySchurKKTSolver
    Solves KKT conditions for NewtonOptimizer, using Schur block factorization and Cholesky decomposition.
    ConvergenceEpsilon
    Defines an epsilon as a threshold for measuring a small change that approximates convergences of some iterative optimization.
    ConvexOptimizer
    An abstract class that represents a MultivariateOptimizer capable of optimizing convex functions, possibly under a set of convex constraints.
    ConvexOptimizer.NegChecker
    A ConvergenceChecker specialized to be used as a halting condition when solving for feasible points.
    HaltingCondition
    Represents a custom halting condition that will cause an optimization to stop iterating if it returns true.
    InequalityConstraintSet
    A collection of convex constraint functions.
    InnerOptimizationData
    A collection of OptimizationData arguments that are passed to an inner optimizer.
    KKTSolution
    This class holds a solution returned from a KKTSolver.
    KKTSolver
    Solves the KKT conditions for NewtonOptimizer.
    LinearEqualityConstraint
    Represents a set of linear equality constraints given as Ax = b.
    LinearFunction
    A linear function b.x + c; The gradient is b, and the Hessian is |0| (all zeros).
    LinearInequalityConstraint
    A set of linear inequality constraints expressed as Ax < b
    LinearTransformFunction
    Applies a linear transform to a function, from f(x) to t(x) = af(x) + b
    LogBarrierFunction
    Given a convex objective function f0 and convex constraints f[k], computes the log barrier function:
    NewtonOptimizer
    Implements convex optimization, using Newton's method.
    QuadraticFunction
    Given A, b, c, implements 0.5*(x^T)A(x) + b.x + c; The gradient is A(x) + b, and the Hessian is A
    SmoothMaxFunction
    Given a set of convex functions f[k] for k = 1,2,..., implements the smooth-max over f[k]: (1/a)log(sum(e^(a f[k]))).
    SVDSchurKKTSolver
    Solves KKT conditions for NewtonOptimizer, using Schur block factorization and SVD decomposition.
    TwiceDifferentiableFunction
    A MultivariateFunction that also has a defined gradient and Hessian
